Dec0de

DEC0DE is a system for recovering information from phones with unknown storage formats, a critical problem for forensic triage. Because phones have myriad custom hardware and software, we examine only the stored data. Via flexible descriptions of typical data structures, and using a classic dynamic programming algorithm, we are able to identify call logs and address book entries in phones across varied models and manufacturers.

Source Code: Github

Paper: Forensic Triage for Mobile Phones with DEC0DE. Robert J. Walls, Erik Learned-Miller, and Brian Neil Levine. In Proc. USENIX Security Symposium, August 2011.
